reviews.review: As someone who doesn't usually like FPS games, this game is actually quite good. It runs well, looks amazing, and it's gameplay and plot were intresting enough to keep me around till the end of the game. It's a lot of fun, if you've not played it yet, you should give it a go.

Una de las mejores compras de mi colecciÃ²n de juegos, no te quedes sin jugar una buena historia, jugabilidad y deleite visual, en resumen: Divertido, tragico y cariÃ±o, un juegazo.

Love this game! 

Always been a bioshock fan, bought infinite a few years back and dove head first into it. 

This is one of the few games where a linear storyline doesn't bother me. The way the story is told, and the immersion are on point. This game was far ahead of its time and I'm fortunate to have played it when it was in its prime.

The story is also incredibly deep, even more so if you have played the previous games in the series and then play the DLC. Do yourself a favor and don't spoil the ending if you haven't played it yet. Yes, you could watch a let's play, but you get so much more out of playing it yourself! 

I would highly recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a quality single player experience!

Give me back my time, damn it.

I've been out of the gaming scene for some years. I thus can't compare BI to other FPSs. I liked the visuals, the atmosphere, the gameplay. I thought I liked the story too. And I did, for some time.

But how I hated the ending.

I won't point to plot holes, I won't discuss interpretations, I won't say it makes no sense. Oh, yes, I understand it. I have read about it. For all intents and purposes, the story internal logic can be flawless and it won't change a thing to me. Spoilers follow.

I felt betrayed by this story. Basically, I have two choices: to be baptised and become a murderous megalomaniac racist, or reject it and become a man doomed to commit suicide by daughter. Both alternatives,you see, highly uplifting.

Thanks but no thanks, I have enough real life to come to a game to be drown (see what I did there?) in depressive fatalism. 

Bonus point: if you agree with this and have not read The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy series... do yourself a favor and invest your time in something else.
Totally worth it. Great game. Great story. Last but not least, great Linux port.

[h1]BioShock Infinite Review[/h1]
[b]by KTMboyz[/b]

[i]"There's a world of difference between what we see and what is..."[/i]

It's been quite a while since a game has suprised me this much.  Probably since I played the first BioShock to be honest.  I jumped into Infinite not expecting anything, and I will admit, it's one of the better choices I've made going into a game.  I love the first two BioShock's, I dived into the lore, got used to the gameplay mechanics and overall felt good about my investment into the series.  Then I played Infinite; my mind was blown from the very first second!  Let me talk about why Infinite climbed it's way up to my favourite BioShock game and one of my favourite FPS games of all time.

Yes, as somebody who played the other two first, I am aware of the many changes Infinite has made.  From gameplay changes to being in the sky instead of the sea; I understand alot of fans were disapointed by this.  Me, I was happy with the changes.  Gunfights are now super climactic and allow for you to pull off badass moves and use  [strike]plasmids[/strike] "Vigors" quickly, (gotta get used to that).  Simply walking around, enjoying the impressive graphics and just listeng to Elizabeth speak would make a great game on it's own.  The narrative is amazing and instead of having one major turning point 3/4 into the game like the first one, everything seems new and unexpected, which i love!  Booker and Elizabeth's friendship go through ups and downs and it's nice to see realistic conversations throughout the game.  

What more can I say about it?  Gameplay is deep and exciting and the story is complex and interesting.  I'm going to give this game a perfect 10!  As much as I look for flaws; I can't seem to find any.  Sure, it's not "BioShock" according to the fans, but as a first-person shooter, it's everything i'm looking for in one package.  Enjoy.

[h1]10/10[/h1]
(PS:  The ending is just "Perfect"  Trust me)

BioShock Inifinite is my first foray into the BioShock games and it's convinced me to make sure that it's not my last.

The game is a decent story bundled with a fun shooter all placed in a fascinating setting.

The action is satisfying with both guns and a few abilities at your disposal. The setting is a place founded on the notion of old-fashioned American exceptionalism with no regards to other people. The story alongside the gameplay doesn't take too much time to get through and my playtime reflects how long it took me. It follows two characters for the most part and has a few twists and turns.

P.S. I usually don't care about graphics, but this game is stylized well. It looks rather pretty at some scenes.
